abstract: European Union antitrust officials raided the offices of several international airlines as part of an investigation into suspected price fixing on scheduled flights between the Europe and Japan. Spokeswomen for Lufthansa of Germany and KLM Royal Dutch Airlines, a unit of Air France-KLM, confirmed that their offices in Frankfurt and Amsterdam had been raided and said they were cooperating with the investigation. The European Commission, the European Union’s executive arm, said it and national competition regulators had carried out unannounced inspections at the premises of a number of international airlines. It did not identify the carriers. The commission believes that the companies may have violated its rules on restrictive business practices, officials said, without elaborating.

lead_paragraph: European Union antitrust officials raided the offices of several international airlines as part of an investigation into suspected price fixing on scheduled flights between the Europe and Japan. Spokeswomen for Lufthansa of Germany and KLM Royal Dutch Airlines, a unit of Air France-KLM, confirmed that their offices in Frankfurt and Amsterdam had been raided and said they were cooperating with the investigation. The European Commission, the European Union’s executive arm, said it and national competition regulators had carried out unannounced inspections at the premises of a number of international airlines. It did not identify the carriers. The commission believes that the companies may have violated its rules on restrictive business practices, officials said, without elaborating.

headline.main: Air Fares to Japan Are Investigated
